results.title: The Big deal on Maddona Street = I soliti ignoto = Persons unknown = The usual unidentified thieves
results.creator_credit: Mario Monicelli, Franco Cristaldi and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This now classic Italian spoof on the caper film, about a group of incompetent amateur crooks who plan an elaborate but misguided robbery on a store, was hugely successful in both Italy and the United States. Primarily a take-off of Dassian’s ‘Rififi’ (1955), its comedy of errors is firmly rooted in social conditions of deprivation. Moncelli uses the conventions of the heist film to maximum effect and adds a steady stream of sight gags played out by an impeccable cast featuring Vittorio Gassman, Renato Salvatori, Claudia Cardinale and Marcello Mastroianni, with hilarious results. The jazz score by Piero Umiliani is also notable. From a story by Age Scarpelli. Credits: Director, Mario Monicelli ; writers, Age Scarpelli, Suso Cecchi D’amico, Mario Monicelli ; photography, Erico Menczer ; music, Piero Umiliani. Nominated for an Oscar for Best Foreign Film in 1958.

results.title: The Big day
results.creator_credit: Chris Fitchett and Audio Visual Workshop
results.brief_description: Suggests that one is wise to plan years ahead financially and otherwise, to be ready for retirement when the time comes. Cast includes Bill Kelly, Jennifer Hearne and Trevor Kilgour. Photographer: John Ruane.

results.title: The Big country (S)
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Gregory Peck, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Big country is a western epic that has it all: a classic story, an all-star cast and the impeccable direction of Academy Award winning veteran, William Wyler. Gregory Peck stars as a sea captain who trades the expanse of the oceans for the open range of the West and grows to regret his choice. Charlton Heston is the menacing ranch foreman who loves the land and has a keen eye on McKay’s fiancee (Carroll Baker). The superlative cast is rounded out by Burl Ives in an Oscar winning role, Jean Simmons, Charles Bickford and Chuck Connors.

results.title: The Big combo
results.creator_credit: Joseph Lewis, Sidney Harmon and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: This is not just another gangster movie, but far more a private obsessional duel, a battle of wills between a smooth-tongued gangster and a fixated cop, which is resolved in terms of individual foibles and motivations. The film deals with a new brand of corporate business-minded gangster. The film’s two main characters (Leonard Diamond and Mr. Brown) run along parallel lines: both are haunted by chimeras of innocence, they are both aggressive in the pursuit of their differing ambitions. Stars Cornel Wilde, Richard Conte, Brian Donlevy, Jean Wallace.

results.title: The Big circus
results.creator_credit: Joseph Newman, Irwin Allen and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: Victor Mature plays circus owner, Hank Whirling, an autocratic boss whose business is under threat of closure from changes to the entertainment industry and a saboteur whose work threatens lives as well as business. After borrowing heavily to keep the circus afloat Whirling is burdened with the presence of bank officer Randy Sherman and publicist Helen Harrison. Moving with the times is not one of Whirling’s strong points and he takes exception to having a female press agent. In a bid to boost dwindling sales Whirling reluctantly agrees to allow Zack Colino, his top aerialist, to perform a media attention grabbing feat - crossing Niagara Falls on a tight rope. Humour, comedy and colour pervade the film that constitutes good-natured family fun, as well as consisting of some stunning stunts. Originally filmed in cinemascope, “The Big circus” features a star cast including Vincent Price, Peter Lorre and Red Buttons. This film was to be one of Mature’s last leading men roles. Producer Allen Irwin, also co-wrote the screenplay with some-time Hitchcock collaborator Charles Bennet.

results.title: The Big chill [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Michael Shamberg and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: The archetypal “Baby Boomers” movie of the 80’s which focuses on a group of college friends from the 60’s who have exchanged their radical ideals for Mercedes’ and “Yuppiedom”. In coming together at the funeral of one of their group, they strive to regain touch, not only with one another but with themselves. What follows is a weekend of drugs, sex, a re-examination of their anti-establishment days and a reconciliation of their past with their present. “In a cool world you need your friends to keep you warm.” This film will remain a nostalgic favourite. It features a great soundtrack and an early screen appearance by Kevin Costner as the corpse. Cast includes Tom Berenger, Glenn Close, Jeff Goldblum, William Hurt, Kevin Kline, Mary Kay Place, Meg Tilly and Jobeth Williams.

results.title: The Big blue
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Patrice Ledoux and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the poignant story of Jacques Mayol (Jean-Marc Barr), a free diving champion who must choose between his passion for the sea and his love of a New York businesswoman (Rosanna Arquette). His mettle as a human being is tested when he finds he must choose between two vastly different lifestyles. One with the passionate woman in one of the worlds largest cities and the other in a small village close to the sea which has always been his life. An extraordinarily beautiful film set against spectacular backdrops in Sicily, Paris, New York and the Greek Isles.

results.title: The Big bang
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Once Hubble’s Law was accepted; that is the Law of an Expanding Universe, two theories about the creation of the universe were put forward. The Big Bang Theory stated that an initial tiny volume of matter exploded outwards, thus creating the beginnings of the universe. The Steady State Theory put forward by Sir Fred Hoyle, proposed that the universe never had a beginning but that matter was created as the universe expanded. The latter theory was abandoned by scientists, however the quest to determine the age and origin of the cosmos is still of vital importance for astronomers.
